alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Menard; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:54PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Schleicher, Kimble, southwestern Menard and eastern Sutton Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 453 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Adams to near London. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Junction, Telegraph, Segovia, South Llano River State Park, Roosevelt, Fort Mckavett, Adams, Camp Sol Mayer, Cleo, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 1773, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2596 And Ranch Road 864, Yates Crossing, I-10 Near The Sutton-Kimble County Line, Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 2084, Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line and Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 410 and 471. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
